00234 static char gPyExpandPath_doc[] =
00235 "(path) - Converts a blender internal path into a proper file system path.\n\
00236 path - the string path to convert.\n\n\
00237 Use / as directory separator in path\n\
00238 You can use '//' at the start of the string to define a relative path;\n\
00239 Blender replaces that string by the directory of the startup .blend or runtime\n\
00240 file to make a full path name (doesn't change during the game, even if you load\n\
00241 other .blend).\n\
00242 The function also converts the directory separator to the local file system format.";
00243 
00244 static PyObject* gPyExpandPath(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00245 {
00246     char expanded[FILE_MAX];
00247     char* filename;
00248     
00249     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"s:ExpandPath",&filename))
00250         return NULL;
00251 
00252     BLI_strncpy(expanded, filename, FILE_MAX);
00253     BLI_path_abs(expanded, gp_GamePythonPath);
00254     return PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(expanded);
00255 }

00299 static char gPySaveGlobalDict_doc[] =
00300     "saveGlobalDict()\n"
00301     "Saves bge.logic.globalDict to a file";
00302 
00303 static PyObject* gPySaveGlobalDict(PyObject*)
00304 {
00305     char marshal_path[512];
00306     char *marshal_buffer = NULL;
00307     unsigned int marshal_length;
00308     FILE *fp = NULL;
00309 
00310     pathGamePythonConfig(marshal_path);
00311     marshal_length = saveGamePythonConfig(&marshal_buffer);
00312 
00313     if (marshal_length && marshal_buffer)
00314     {
00315         fp = fopen(marshal_path, "wb");
00316 
00317         if (fp)
00318         {
00319             if (fwrite(marshal_buffer, 1, marshal_length, fp) != marshal_length)
00320                 printf("Warning: could not write marshal data\n");
00321 
00322             fclose(fp);
00323         } else {
00324             printf("Warning: could not open marshal file\n");
00325         }
00326     } else {
00327         printf("Warning: could not create marshal buffer\n");
00328     }
00329 
00330     if (marshal_buffer)
00331         delete [] marshal_buffer;
00332 
00333     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00334 }
00335 
00336 static char gPyLoadGlobalDict_doc[] =
00337     "LoadGlobalDict()\n"
00338     "Loads bge.logic.globalDict from a file";
00339 
00340 static PyObject* gPyLoadGlobalDict(PyObject*)
00341 {
00342     char marshal_path[512];
00343     char *marshal_buffer = NULL;
00344     size_t marshal_length;
00345     FILE *fp = NULL;
00346     int result;
00347 
00348     pathGamePythonConfig(marshal_path);
00349 
00350     fp = fopen(marshal_path, "rb");
00351 
00352     if (fp) {
00353         // obtain file size:
00354         fseek (fp, 0, SEEK_END);
00355         marshal_length = (size_t)ftell(fp);
00356         rewind(fp);
00357 
00358         marshal_buffer = (char*)malloc (sizeof(char)*marshal_length);
00359 
00360         result = fread(marshal_buffer, 1, marshal_length, fp);
00361 
00362         if (result == marshal_length) {
00363             loadGamePythonConfig(marshal_buffer, marshal_length);
00364         } else {
00365             printf("Warning: could not read all of '%s'\n", marshal_path);
00366         }
00367 
00368         free(marshal_buffer);
00369         fclose(fp);
00370     } else {
00371         printf("Warning: could not open '%s'\n", marshal_path);
00372     }
00373 
00374     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00375 }

00385 static PyObject* gPySendMessage(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00386 {

00404

00504 static PyObject* gPyGetBlendFileList(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00505 {
00506     char cpath[sizeof(gp_GamePythonPath)];
00507     char *searchpath = NULL;
00508     PyObject* list, *value;
00509 
00510     DIR *dp;
00511     struct dirent *dirp;
00512 
00513     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "|s:getBlendFileList", &searchpath))
00514         return NULL;
00515 
00516     list = PyList_New(0);
00517     
00518     if (searchpath) {
00519         BLI_strncpy(cpath, searchpath, FILE_MAX);
00520         BLI_path_abs(cpath, gp_GamePythonPath);
00521     } else {
00522         /* Get the dir only */
00523         BLI_split_dir_part(gp_GamePythonPath, cpath, sizeof(cpath));
00524     }
00525 
00526     if ((dp  = opendir(cpath)) == NULL) {
00527         /* todo, show the errno, this shouldnt happen anyway if the blendfile is readable */
00528         fprintf(stderr, "Could not read directoty (%s) failed, code %d (%s)\n", cpath, errno, strerror(errno));
00529         return list;
00530     }
00531     
00532     while ((dirp = readdir(dp)) != NULL) {
00533         if (BLI_testextensie(dirp->d_name, ".blend")) {
00534             value= PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(dirp->d_name);
00535             PyList_Append(list, value);
00536             Py_DECREF(value);
00537         }
00538     }
00539     
00540     closedir(dp);
00541     return list;
00542 }

00549 static PyObject* gPyAddScene(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00550 {
00551     char* name;
00552     int overlay = 1;
00553     
00554     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "s|i:addScene", &name , &overlay))
00555         return NULL;
00556     
00557     gp_KetsjiEngine->ConvertAndAddScene(name, (overlay != 0));
00558 
00559     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00560 }

00570 static const char *gPyGetSceneList_doc =
00571 "getSceneList()\n"
00572 "Return a list of converted scenes.\n";
00573 static PyObject* gPyGetSceneList(PyObject* self)
00574 {
00575     KX_KetsjiEngine* m_engine = KX_GetActiveEngine();
00576     PyObject* list;
00577     KX_SceneList* scenes = m_engine->CurrentScenes();
00578     int numScenes = scenes->size();
00579     int i;
00580     
00581     list = PyList_New(numScenes);
00582     
00583     for (i=0;i<numScenes;i++)
00584     {
00585         KX_Scene* scene = scenes->at(i);
00586         PyList_SET_ITEM(list, i, scene->GetProxy());
00587     }
00588 
00589     return list;
00590 }

00598 static PyObject *pyPrintExt(PyObject *,PyObject *,PyObject *)
00599 {
00600 #define pprint(x) std::cout << x << std::endl;
00601     bool count=0;
00602     bool support=0;
00603     pprint("Supported Extensions...");
00604     pprint(" GL_ARB_shader_objects supported?       "<< (GLEW_ARB_shader_objects?"yes.":"no."));
00605     count = 1;
00606 
00607     support= GLEW_ARB_vertex_shader;
00608     pprint(" GL_ARB_vertex_shader supported?        "<< (support?"yes.":"no."));
00609     count = 1;
00610     if (support) {
00611         pprint(" ----------Details----------");
00612         int max=0;
00613         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_VERTEX_UNIFORM_COMPONENTS_ARB, (GLint*)&max);
00614         pprint("  Max uniform components." << max);
00615 
00616         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_VARYING_FLOATS_ARB, (GLint*)&max);
00617         pprint("  Max varying floats." << max);
00618 
00619         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_VERTEX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS_ARB, (GLint*)&max);
00620         pprint("  Max vertex texture units." << max);
00621     
00622         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS_ARB, (GLint*)&max);
00623         pprint("  Max combined texture units." << max);
00624         pprint("");
00625     }
00626 
00627     support=GLEW_ARB_fragment_shader;
00628     pprint(" GL_ARB_fragment_shader supported?      "<< (support?"yes.":"no."));
00629     count = 1;
00630     if (support) {
00631         pprint(" ----------Details----------");
00632         int max=0;
00633         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_FRAGMENT_UNIFORM_COMPONENTS_ARB, (GLint*)&max);
00634         pprint("  Max uniform components." << max);
00635         pprint("");
00636     }
00637 
00638     support = GLEW_ARB_texture_cube_map;
00639     pprint(" GL_ARB_texture_cube_map supported?     "<< (support?"yes.":"no."));
00640     count = 1;
00641     if (support) {
00642         pprint(" ----------Details----------");
00643         int size=0;
00644         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE_ARB, (GLint*)&size);
00645         pprint("  Max cubemap size." << size);
00646         pprint("");
00647     }
00648 
00649     support = GLEW_ARB_multitexture;
00650     count = 1;
00651     pprint(" GL_ARB_multitexture supported?         "<< (support?"yes.":"no."));
00652     if (support) {
00653         pprint(" ----------Details----------");
00654         int units=0;
00655         glGetIntegerv(GL_MAX_TEXTURE_UNITS_ARB, (GLint*)&units);
00656         pprint("  Max texture units available.  " << units);
00657         pprint("");
00658     }
00659 
00660     pprint(" GL_ARB_texture_env_combine supported?  "<< (GLEW_ARB_texture_env_combine?"yes.":"no."));
00661     count = 1;
00662 
00663     if (!count)
00664         pprint("No extenstions are used in this build");
00665 
00666     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00667 }
00668 
00669 static PyObject *gLibLoad(PyObject*, PyObject* args, PyObject* kwds)
00670 {
00671     KX_Scene *kx_scene= gp_KetsjiScene;
00672     char *path;
00673     char *group;
00674     Py_buffer py_buffer;
00675     py_buffer.buf = NULL;
00676     char *err_str= NULL;
00677 
00678     short options=0;
00679     int load_actions=0, verbose=0;
00680 
00681     static const char *kwlist[] = {"path", "group", "buffer", "load_actions", "verbose", NULL};
00682     
00683     if (!PyArg_ParseTupleAndKeywords(args, kwds, "ss|y*ii:LibLoad", const_cast<char**>(kwlist),
00684                                     &path, &group, &py_buffer, &load_actions, &verbose))
00685         return NULL;
00686 
00687     /* setup options */
00688     if (load_actions != 0)
00689         options |= KX_BlenderSceneConverter::LIB_LOAD_LOAD_ACTIONS;
00690     if (verbose != 0)
00691         options |= KX_BlenderSceneConverter::LIB_LOAD_VERBOSE;
00692 
00693     if (!py_buffer.buf)
00694     {
00695         char abs_path[FILE_MAX];
00696         // Make the path absolute
00697         BLI_strncpy(abs_path, path, sizeof(abs_path));
00698         BLI_path_abs(abs_path, gp_GamePythonPath);
00699 
00700         if (kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->LinkBlendFilePath(abs_path, group, kx_scene, &err_str, options)) {
00701             Py_RETURN_TRUE;
00702         }
00703     }
00704     else
00705     {
00706 
00707         if (kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->LinkBlendFileMemory(py_buffer.buf, py_buffer.len, path, group, kx_scene, &err_str, options)) {
00708             PyBuffer_Release(&py_buffer);
00709             Py_RETURN_TRUE;
00710         }
00711 
00712         PyBuffer_Release(&py_buffer);
00713     }
00714     
00715     if (err_str) {
00716         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, err_str);
00717         return NULL;
00718     }
00719     
00720     Py_RETURN_FALSE;
00721 }
00722 
00723 static PyObject *gLibNew(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00724 {
00725     KX_Scene *kx_scene= gp_KetsjiScene;
00726     char *path;
00727     char *group;
00728     const char *name;
00729     PyObject *names;
00730     int idcode;
00731 
00732     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"ssO!:LibNew",&path, &group, &PyList_Type, &names))
00733         return NULL;
00734     
00735     if (kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->GetMainDynamicPath(path))
00736     {
00737         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_KeyError, "the name of the path given exists");
00738         return NULL;
00739     }
00740     
00741     idcode= BKE_idcode_from_name(group);
00742     if (idcode==0) {
00743         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "invalid group given \"%s\"", group);
00744         return NULL;
00745     }
00746     
00747     Main *maggie= (Main *)MEM_callocN( sizeof(Main), "BgeMain");
00748     kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->GetMainDynamic().push_back(maggie);
00749     strncpy(maggie->name, path, sizeof(maggie->name)-1);
00750     
00751     /* Copy the object into main */
00752     if (idcode==ID_ME) {
00753         PyObject *ret= PyList_New(0);
00754         PyObject *item;
00755         for (Py_ssize_t i= 0; i < PyList_GET_SIZE(names); i++) {
00756             name= _PyUnicode_AsString(PyList_GET_ITEM(names, i));
00757             if (name) {
00758                 RAS_MeshObject *meshobj= kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->ConvertMeshSpecial(kx_scene, maggie, name);
00759                 if (meshobj) {
00760                     KX_MeshProxy* meshproxy = new KX_MeshProxy(meshobj);
00761                     item= meshproxy->NewProxy(true);
00762                     PyList_Append(ret, item);
00763                     Py_DECREF(item);
00764                 }
00765             }
00766             else {
00767                 PyErr_Clear(); /* wasnt a string, ignore for now */
00768             }
00769         }
00770         
00771         return ret;
00772     }
00773     else {
00774         PyErr_Format(PyExc_ValueError, "only \"Mesh\" group currently supported");
00775         return NULL;
00776     }
00777     
00778     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00779 }
00780 
00781 static PyObject *gLibFree(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00782 {
00783     KX_Scene *kx_scene= gp_KetsjiScene;
00784     char *path;
00785 
00786     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"s:LibFree",&path))
00787         return NULL;
00788 
00789     if (kx_scene->GetSceneConverter()->FreeBlendFile(path))
00790     {
00791         Py_RETURN_TRUE;
00792     }
00793     else {
00794         Py_RETURN_FALSE;
00795     }
00796 }
00797 
00798 static PyObject *gLibList(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
00799 {
00800     vector<Main*> &dynMaggie = gp_KetsjiScene->GetSceneConverter()->GetMainDynamic();
00801     int i= 0;
00802     PyObject *list= PyList_New(dynMaggie.size());
00803     
00804     for (vector<Main*>::iterator it=dynMaggie.begin(); !(it==dynMaggie.end()); it++)
00805     {
00806         PyList_SET_ITEM(list, i++, PyUnicode_FromString( (*it)->name) );
00807     }
00808     
00809     return list;
00810 }

00881 {
00882     int visible;
00883     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"i:showMouse",&visible))
00884         return NULL;
00885     
00886     if (visible)
00887     {
00888         if (gp_Canvas)
00889             gp_Canvas->SetMouseState(RAS_ICanvas::MOUSE_NORMAL);
00890     } else
00891     {
00892         if (gp_Canvas)
00893             gp_Canvas->SetMouseState(RAS_ICanvas::MOUSE_INVISIBLE);
00894     }
00895     
00896     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00897 }

00980     if (wi->hasWorld())

00982 
00983     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00984 }

01113 
01114 static int getGLSLSettingFlag(const char *setting)
01115 {
01116     if (strcmp(setting, "lights") == 0)
01117         return GAME_GLSL_NO_LIGHTS;
01118     else if (strcmp(setting, "shaders") == 0)
01119         return GAME_GLSL_NO_SHADERS;
01120     else if (strcmp(setting, "shadows") == 0)
01121         return GAME_GLSL_NO_SHADOWS;
01122     else if (strcmp(setting, "ramps") == 0)
01123         return GAME_GLSL_NO_RAMPS;
01124     else if (strcmp(setting, "nodes") == 0)
01125         return GAME_GLSL_NO_NODES;
01126     else if (strcmp(setting, "extra_textures") == 0)
01127         return GAME_GLSL_NO_EXTRA_TEX;
01128     else
01129         return -1;
01130 }
01131 
01132 static PyObject* gPySetGLSLMaterialSetting(PyObject*,
01133                                             PyObject* args,
01134                                             PyObject*)
01135 {
01136     GlobalSettings *gs= gp_KetsjiEngine->GetGlobalSettings();
01137     char *setting;
01138     int enable, flag, sceneflag;
01139 
01140     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"si:setGLSLMaterialSetting",&setting,&enable))
01141         return NULL;
01142     
01143     flag = getGLSLSettingFlag(setting);
01144     
01145     if  (flag==-1) {
01146         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Rasterizer.setGLSLMaterialSetting(string): glsl setting is not known");
01147         return NULL;
01148     }
01149 
01150     sceneflag= gs->glslflag;
01151     
01152     if (enable)
01153         gs->glslflag &= ~flag;
01154     else
01155         gs->glslflag |= flag;
01156 
01157     /* display lists and GLSL materials need to be remade */
01158     if (sceneflag != gs->glslflag) {
01159         GPU_materials_free();
01160         if (gp_KetsjiEngine) {
01161             KX_SceneList *scenes = gp_KetsjiEngine->CurrentScenes();
01162             KX_SceneList::iterator it;
01163 
01164             for (it=scenes->begin(); it!=scenes->end(); it++)
01165                 if ((*it)->GetBucketManager()) {
01166                     (*it)->GetBucketManager()->ReleaseDisplayLists();
01167                     (*it)->GetBucketManager()->ReleaseMaterials();
01168                 }
01169         }
01170     }
01171 
01172     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01173 }
01174 
01175 static PyObject* gPyGetGLSLMaterialSetting(PyObject*, 
01176                                      PyObject* args, 
01177                                      PyObject*)
01178 {
01179     GlobalSettings *gs= gp_KetsjiEngine->GetGlobalSettings();
01180     char *setting;
01181     int enabled = 0, flag;
01182 
01183     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"s:getGLSLMaterialSetting",&setting))
01184         return NULL;
01185     
01186     flag = getGLSLSettingFlag(setting);
01187     
01188     if  (flag==-1) {
01189         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Rasterizer.getGLSLMaterialSetting(string): glsl setting is not known");
01190         return NULL;
01191     }
01192 
01193     enabled = ((gs->glslflag & flag) != 0);
01194     return PyLong_FromSsize_t(enabled);
01195 }
01196 
01197 #define KX_TEXFACE_MATERIAL             0
01198 #define KX_BLENDER_MULTITEX_MATERIAL    1
01199 #define KX_BLENDER_GLSL_MATERIAL        2
01200 
01201 static PyObject* gPySetMaterialType(PyObject*,
01202                                     PyObject* args,
01203                                     PyObject*)
01204 {
01205     GlobalSettings *gs= gp_KetsjiEngine->GetGlobalSettings();
01206     int type;
01207 
01208     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"i:setMaterialType",&type))
01209         return NULL;
01210 
01211     if (type == KX_BLENDER_GLSL_MATERIAL)
01212         gs->matmode= GAME_MAT_GLSL;
01213     else if (type == KX_BLENDER_MULTITEX_MATERIAL)
01214         gs->matmode= GAME_MAT_MULTITEX;
01215     else if (type == KX_TEXFACE_MATERIAL)
01216         gs->matmode= GAME_MAT_TEXFACE;
01217     else {
01218         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Rasterizer.setMaterialType(int): material type is not known");
01219         return NULL;
01220     }
01221 
01222     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01223 }
01224 
01225 static PyObject* gPyGetMaterialType(PyObject*)
01226 {
01227     GlobalSettings *gs= gp_KetsjiEngine->GetGlobalSettings();
01228     int flag;
01229 
01230     if (gs->matmode == GAME_MAT_GLSL)
01231         flag = KX_BLENDER_GLSL_MATERIAL;
01232     else if (gs->matmode == GAME_MAT_MULTITEX)
01233         flag = KX_BLENDER_MULTITEX_MATERIAL;
01234     else
01235         flag = KX_TEXFACE_MATERIAL;
01236     
01237     return PyLong_FromSsize_t(flag);
01238 }
01239 
01240 static PyObject* gPySetAnisotropicFiltering(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
01241 {
01242     short level;
01243 
01244     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "h:setAnisotropicFiltering", &level))
01245         return NULL;
01246 
01247     if (level != 1 && level != 2 && level != 4 && level != 8 && level != 16) {
01248         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Rasterizer.setAnisotropicFiltering(level): Expected value of 1, 2, 4, 8, or 16 for value");
01249         return NULL;
01250     }
01251 
01252     gp_Rasterizer->SetAnisotropicFiltering(level);
01253 
01254     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01255 }
01256 
01257 static PyObject* gPyGetAnisotropicFiltering(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
01258 {
01259     return PyLong_FromLong(gp_Rasterizer->GetAnisotropicFiltering());
01260 }
01261 
01262 static PyObject* gPyDrawLine(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
01263 {
01264     PyObject* ob_from;
01265     PyObject* ob_to;
01266     PyObject* ob_color;
01267 
01268     if (!gp_Rasterizer) {
01269         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError, "Rasterizer.drawLine(obFrom, obTo, color): Rasterizer not available");
01270         return NULL;
01271     }
01272 
01273     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"OOO:drawLine",&ob_from,&ob_to,&ob_color))
01274         return NULL;
01275 
01276     MT_Vector3 from;
01277     MT_Vector3 to;
01278     MT_Vector3 color;
01279     if (!PyVecTo(ob_from, from))
01280         return NULL;
01281     if (!PyVecTo(ob_to, to))
01282         return NULL;
01283     if (!PyVecTo(ob_color, color))
01284         return NULL;
01285 
01286     gp_Rasterizer->DrawDebugLine(from,to,color);
01287     
01288     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01289 }
01290 
01291 static PyObject* gPySetWindowSize(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
01292 {
01293     int width, height;
01294     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "ii:resize", &width, &height))
01295         return NULL;
01296 
01297     gp_Canvas->ResizeWindow(width, height);
01298     Py_RETURN_NONE;
01299 }

01345 
01346 // Initialization function for the module (*must* be called initGameLogic)
01347 
01348 static char GameLogic_module_documentation[] =
01349 "This is the Python API for the game engine of bge.logic"
01350 ;
01351 
01352 static char Rasterizer_module_documentation[] =
01353 "This is the Python API for the game engine of Rasterizer"
01354 ;
01355 
01356 static struct PyModuleDef GameLogic_module_def = {
01357     {}, /* m_base */
01358     "GameLogic",  /* m_name */
01359     GameLogic_module_documentation,  /* m_doc */
01360     0,  /* m_size */
01361     game_methods,  /* m_methods */
01362     0,  /* m_reload */
01363     0,  /* m_traverse */
01364     0,  /* m_clear */
01365     0,  /* m_free */
01366 };
01367 
01368 PyObject* initGameLogic(KX_KetsjiEngine *engine, KX_Scene* scene) // quick hack to get gravity hook
01369 {
01370     PyObject* m;
01371     PyObject* d;
01372     PyObject* item; /* temp PyObject* storage */
01373     
01374     gp_KetsjiEngine = engine;
01375     gp_KetsjiScene = scene;
01376 
01377     gUseVisibilityTemp=false;
01378     
01379     PyObjectPlus::ClearDeprecationWarning(); /* Not that nice to call here but makes sure warnings are reset between loading scenes */
01380     
01381     /* Use existing module where possible
01382      * be careful not to init any runtime vars after this */
01383     m = PyImport_ImportModule( "GameLogic" );
01384     if (m) {
01385         Py_DECREF(m);
01386         return m;
01387     }
01388     else {
01389         PyErr_Clear();
01390         // Create the module and add the functions  
01391         m = PyModule_Create(&GameLogic_module_def);
01392         PyDict_SetItemString(PySys_GetObject("modules"), GameLogic_module_def.m_name, m);
01393     }
01394     
01395     // Add some symbolic constants to the module
01396     d = PyModule_GetDict(m);
01397     
01398     // can be overwritten later for gameEngine instances that can load new blend files and re-initialize this module
01399     // for now its safe to make sure it exists for other areas such as the web plugin
01400     
01401     PyDict_SetItemString(d, "globalDict", item=PyDict_New()); Py_DECREF(item);
01402 
01403     // Add keyboard and mouse attributes to this module
01404     MT_assert(!gp_PythonKeyboard);
01405     gp_PythonKeyboard = new SCA_PythonKeyboard(gp_KetsjiEngine->GetKeyboardDevice());
01406     PyDict_SetItemString(d, "keyboard", gp_PythonKeyboard->NewProxy(true));
01407 
01408     MT_assert(!gp_PythonMouse);
01409     gp_PythonMouse = new SCA_PythonMouse(gp_KetsjiEngine->GetMouseDevice(), gp_Canvas);
01410     PyDict_SetItemString(d, "mouse", gp_PythonMouse->NewProxy(true));
01411 
01412     ErrorObject = PyUnicode_FromString("GameLogic.error");
01413     PyDict_SetItemString(d, "error", ErrorObject);
01414     Py_DECREF(ErrorObject);
01415     
01416     // XXXX Add constants here
01417     /* To use logic bricks, we need some sort of constants. Here, we associate */
01418     /* constants and sumbolic names. Add them to dictionary d.                 */
01419 
01420     /* 1. true and false: needed for everyone                                  */
01421     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_TRUE,  SCA_ILogicBrick::KX_TRUE);
01422     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_FALSE, SCA_ILogicBrick::KX_FALSE);
01423 
01424     /* 2. Property sensor                                                      */
01425     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_PROPSENSOR_EQUAL,      SCA_PropertySensor::KX_PROPSENSOR_EQUAL);
01426     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_PROPSENSOR_NOTEQUAL,   SCA_PropertySensor::KX_PROPSENSOR_NOTEQUAL);
01427     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_PROPSENSOR_INTERVAL,   SCA_PropertySensor::KX_PROPSENSOR_INTERVAL);
01428     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_PROPSENSOR_CHANGED,    SCA_PropertySensor::KX_PROPSENSOR_CHANGED);
01429     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_PROPSENSOR_EXPRESSION, SCA_PropertySensor::KX_PROPSENSOR_EXPRESSION);
01430 
01431     /* 3. Constraint actuator                                                  */
01432     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_CONSTRAINTACT_LOCX, KX_ConstraintActuator::KX_ACT_CONSTRAINT_LOCX);
01433     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_CONSTRAINTACT_LOCY, KX_ConstraintActuator::KX_ACT_CONSTRAINT_LOCY);

01713 
01714 /* Explanation of 
01715  * 
01716  * - backupPySysObjects()       : stores sys.path in gp_OrigPythonSysPath
01717  * - initPySysObjects(main) : initializes the blendfile and library paths
01718  * - restorePySysObjects()      : restores sys.path from gp_OrigPythonSysPath
01719  * 
01720  * These exist so the current blend dir "//" can always be used to import modules from.
01721  * the reason we need a few functions for this is that python is not only used by the game engine
01722  * so we cant just add to sys.path all the time, it would leave pythons state in a mess.
01723  * It would also be incorrect since loading blend files for new levels etc would always add to sys.path
01724  * 
01725  * To play nice with blenders python, the sys.path is backed up and the current blendfile along
01726  * with all its lib paths are added to the sys path.
01727  * When loading a new blendfile, the original sys.path is restored and the new paths are added over the top.
01728  */
01729 
01733 static void backupPySysObjects(void)
01734 {
01735     PyObject *sys_path= PySys_GetObject("path"); /* should never fail */
01736     PyObject *sys_mods= PySys_GetObject("modules"); /* should never fail */
01737     
01738     /* paths */
01739     Py_XDECREF(gp_OrigPythonSysPath); /* just in case its set */
01740     gp_OrigPythonSysPath = PyList_GetSlice(sys_path, 0, INT_MAX); /* copy the list */
01741     
01742     /* modules */
01743     Py_XDECREF(gp_OrigPythonSysModules); /* just in case its set */
01744     gp_OrigPythonSysModules = PyDict_Copy(sys_mods); /* copy the list */
01745     
01746 }
01747 
01748 /* for initPySysObjects only,
01749  * takes a blend path and adds a scripts dir from it
01750  *
01751  * "/home/me/foo.blend" -> "/home/me/scripts"
01752  */
01753 static void initPySysObjects__append(PyObject *sys_path, const char *filename)
01754 {
01755     PyObject *item;
01756     char expanded[FILE_MAX];
01757     
01758     BLI_split_dir_part(filename, expanded, sizeof(expanded)); /* get the dir part of filename only */
01759     BLI_path_abs(expanded, gp_GamePythonPath); /* filename from lib->filename is (always?) absolute, so this may not be needed but it wont hurt */
01760     BLI_cleanup_file(gp_GamePythonPath, expanded); /* Don't use BLI_cleanup_dir because it adds a slash - BREAKS WIN32 ONLY */
01761     item= PyUnicode_DecodeFSDefault(expanded);
01762     
01763 //  printf("SysPath - '%s', '%s', '%s'\n", expanded, filename, gp_GamePythonPath);
01764     
01765     if (PySequence_Index(sys_path, item) == -1) {
01766         PyErr_Clear(); /* PySequence_Index sets a ValueError */
01767         PyList_Insert(sys_path, 0, item);
01768     }
01769     
01770     Py_DECREF(item);
01771 }
01772 static void initPySysObjects(Main *maggie)
01773 {
01774     PyObject *sys_path= PySys_GetObject("path"); /* should never fail */
01775     
01776     if (gp_OrigPythonSysPath==NULL) {
01777         /* backup */
01778         backupPySysObjects();
01779     }
01780     else {
01781         /* get the original sys path when the BGE started */
01782         PyList_SetSlice(sys_path, 0, INT_MAX, gp_OrigPythonSysPath);
01783     }
01784     
01785     Library *lib= (Library *)maggie->library.first;
01786     
01787     while(lib) {
01788         /* lib->name wont work in some cases (on win32),
01789          * even when expanding with gp_GamePythonPath, using lib->filename is less trouble */
01790         initPySysObjects__append(sys_path, lib->filepath);
01791         lib= (Library *)lib->id.next;
01792     }
01793     
01794     initPySysObjects__append(sys_path, gp_GamePythonPath);
01795     
01796 //  fprintf(stderr, "\nNew Path: %d ", PyList_GET_SIZE(sys_path));
01797 //  PyObject_Print(sys_path, stderr, 0);
01798 }
01799 
01800 static void restorePySysObjects(void)
01801 {
01802     if (gp_OrigPythonSysPath==NULL)
01803         return;
01804     
01805     PyObject *sys_path= PySys_GetObject("path"); /* should never fail */
01806     PyObject *sys_mods= PySys_GetObject("modules"); /* should never fail */
01807 
01808     /* paths */
01809     PyList_SetSlice(sys_path, 0, INT_MAX, gp_OrigPythonSysPath);
01810     Py_DECREF(gp_OrigPythonSysPath);
01811     gp_OrigPythonSysPath= NULL;
01812     
01813     /* modules */
01814     PyDict_Clear(sys_mods);
01815     PyDict_Update(sys_mods, gp_OrigPythonSysModules);
01816     Py_DECREF(gp_OrigPythonSysModules);
01817     gp_OrigPythonSysModules= NULL;  
01818     
01819     
01820 //  fprintf(stderr, "\nRestore Path: %d ", PyList_GET_SIZE(sys_path));
01821 //  PyObject_Print(sys_path, stderr, 0);
01822 }
01823 
01824 // Copied from bpy_interface.c
01825 static struct _inittab bge_internal_modules[]= {
01826     {(char *)"mathutils", PyInit_mathutils},
01827     {(char *)"bgl", BPyInit_bgl},
01828     {(char *)"blf", BPyInit_blf},
01829     {(char *)"aud", AUD_initPython},
01830     {NULL, NULL}
01831 };
01832 
01837 PyObject* initGamePlayerPythonScripting(const STR_String& progname, TPythonSecurityLevel level, Main *maggie, int argc, char** argv)
01838 {
01839     /* Yet another gotcha in the py api
01840      * Cant run PySys_SetArgv more then once because this adds the
01841      * binary dir to the sys.path each time.
01842      * Id have thought python being totally restarted would make this ok but
01843      * somehow it remembers the sys.path - Campbell
01844      */
01845     static bool first_time = true;
01846     
01847 #if 0 // TODO - py3
01848     STR_String pname = progname;
01849     Py_SetProgramName(pname.Ptr());
01850 #endif
01851     Py_NoSiteFlag=1;
01852     Py_FrozenFlag=1;
01853 
01854     /* must run before python initializes */
01855     PyImport_ExtendInittab(bge_internal_modules);
01856 
01857     /* find local python installation */
01858     PyC_SetHomePath(BLI_get_folder(BLENDER_SYSTEM_PYTHON, NULL));
01859 
01860     Py_Initialize();
01861     
01862     if (argv && first_time) { /* browser plugins don't currently set this */
01863         // Until python support ascii again, we use our own.
01864         // PySys_SetArgv(argc, argv);
01865         int i;
01866         PyObject *py_argv= PyList_New(argc);
01867 
01868         for (i=0; i<argc; i++)
01869             PyList_SET_ITEM(py_argv, i, PyC_UnicodeFromByte(argv[i]));
01870 
01871         PySys_SetObject("argv", py_argv);
01872         Py_DECREF(py_argv);
01873     }
01874 
01875     bpy_import_init(PyEval_GetBuiltins());
01876 
01877     /* mathutils types are used by the BGE even if we don't import them */
01878     {
01879         PyObject *mod= PyImport_ImportModuleLevel((char *)"mathutils", NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01880         Py_DECREF(mod);
01881     }
01882 
01883 #ifdef WITH_AUDASPACE
01884     /* accessing a SoundActuator's sound results in a crash if aud is not initialized... */
01885     {
01886         PyObject *mod= PyImport_ImportModuleLevel((char *)"aud", NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01887         Py_DECREF(mod);
01888     }
01889 #endif
01890 
01891     initPyTypes();
01892     
01893     bpy_import_main_set(maggie);
01894     
01895     initPySysObjects(maggie);
01896     
01897     first_time = false;
01898     
01899     PyObjectPlus::ClearDeprecationWarning();
01900 
01901     return PyC_DefaultNameSpace(NULL);
01902 }
01903 
01904 void exitGamePlayerPythonScripting()
01905 {   
01906     /* Clean up the Python mouse and keyboard */
01907     delete gp_PythonKeyboard;
01908     gp_PythonKeyboard = NULL;
01909 
01910     delete gp_PythonMouse;
01911     gp_PythonMouse = NULL;
01912 
01913     /* since python restarts we cant let the python backup of the sys.path hang around in a global pointer */
01914     restorePySysObjects(); /* get back the original sys.path and clear the backup */
01915     
01916     Py_Finalize();
01917     bpy_import_main_set(NULL);
01918     PyObjectPlus::ClearDeprecationWarning();
01919 }
01920 
01921 
01922 
01926 PyObject* initGamePythonScripting(const STR_String& progname, TPythonSecurityLevel level, Main *maggie)
01927 {
01928 #if 0 // XXX TODO Py3
01929     STR_String pname = progname;
01930     Py_SetProgramName(pname.Ptr());
01931 #endif
01932     Py_NoSiteFlag=1;
01933     Py_FrozenFlag=1;
01934 
01935 #ifdef WITH_AUDASPACE
01936     /* accessing a SoundActuator's sound results in a crash if aud is not initialized... */
01937     {
01938         PyObject *mod= PyImport_ImportModuleLevel((char *)"aud", NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01939         Py_DECREF(mod);
01940     }
01941 #endif
01942 
01943     initPyTypes();
01944     
01945     bpy_import_main_set(maggie);
01946     
01947     initPySysObjects(maggie);
01948 
01949     PyObjectPlus::NullDeprecationWarning();
01950 
01951     return PyC_DefaultNameSpace(NULL);
01952 }
01953 
01954 void exitGamePythonScripting()
01955 {
01956     /* Clean up the Python mouse and keyboard */
01957     delete gp_PythonKeyboard;
01958     gp_PythonKeyboard = NULL;
01959 
01960     delete gp_PythonMouse;
01961     gp_PythonMouse = NULL;
01962 
01963     restorePySysObjects(); /* get back the original sys.path and clear the backup */
01964     bpy_import_main_set(NULL);
01965     PyObjectPlus::ClearDeprecationWarning();
01966 }
01967 
01968 /* similar to the above functions except it sets up the namespace
01969  * and other more general things */
01970 void setupGamePython(KX_KetsjiEngine* ketsjiengine, KX_Scene* startscene, Main *blenderdata, PyObject * pyGlobalDict, PyObject **gameLogic, PyObject **gameLogic_keys, int argc, char** argv)
01971 {
01972     PyObject* dictionaryobject;
01973 
01974     if (argv) /* player only */
01975         dictionaryobject= initGamePlayerPythonScripting("Ketsji", psl_Lowest, blenderdata, argc, argv);
01976     else
01977         dictionaryobject= initGamePythonScripting("Ketsji", psl_Lowest, blenderdata);
01978 
01979     ketsjiengine->SetPyNamespace(dictionaryobject);
01980     initRasterizer(ketsjiengine->GetRasterizer(), ketsjiengine->GetCanvas());
01981     *gameLogic = initGameLogic(ketsjiengine, startscene);
01982 
01983     /* is set in initGameLogic so only set here if we want it to persist between scenes */
01984     if (pyGlobalDict)
01985         PyDict_SetItemString(PyModule_GetDict(*gameLogic), "globalDict", pyGlobalDict); // Same as importing the module.
01986 
01987     *gameLogic_keys = PyDict_Keys(PyModule_GetDict(*gameLogic));
01988 
01989     initGameKeys();
01990     initPythonConstraintBinding();
01991     initVideoTexture();
01992 
01993     /* could be done a lot more nicely, but for now a quick way to get bge.* working */
01994     PyRun_SimpleString("sys = __import__('sys');"
01995                        "mod = sys.modules['bge'] = type(sys)('bge');"
01996                        "mod.__dict__.update({'logic':__import__('GameLogic'), "
01997                                             "'render':__import__('Rasterizer'), "
01998                                             "'events':__import__('GameKeys'), "
01999                                             "'constraints':__import__('PhysicsConstraints'), "
02000                                             "'types':__import__('GameTypes'), "
02001                                             "'texture':__import__('VideoTexture')});"
02002                        );
02003 }
02004 
02005 static struct PyModuleDef Rasterizer_module_def = {
02006     {}, /* m_base */
02007     "Rasterizer",  /* m_name */
02008     Rasterizer_module_documentation,  /* m_doc */
02009     0,  /* m_size */
02010     rasterizer_methods,  /* m_methods */
02011     0,  /* m_reload */
02012     0,  /* m_traverse */
02013     0,  /* m_clear */
02014     0,  /* m_free */
02015 };
02016 
02017 PyObject* initRasterizer(RAS_IRasterizer* rasty,RAS_ICanvas* canvas)
02018 {
02019     gp_Canvas = canvas;
02020     gp_Rasterizer = rasty;
02021 
02022 
02023     PyObject* m;
02024     PyObject* d;
02025     PyObject* item;
02026 
02027     /* Use existing module where possible
02028      * be careful not to init any runtime vars after this */
02029     m = PyImport_ImportModule( "Rasterizer" );
02030     if (m) {
02031         Py_DECREF(m);
02032         return m;
02033     }
02034     else {
02035         PyErr_Clear();
02036 
02037         // Create the module and add the functions
02038         m = PyModule_Create(&Rasterizer_module_def);
02039         PyDict_SetItemString(PySys_GetObject("modules"), Rasterizer_module_def.m_name, m);
02040     }
02041 
02042     // Add some symbolic constants to the module
02043     d = PyModule_GetDict(m);
02044     ErrorObject = PyUnicode_FromString("Rasterizer.error");
02045     PyDict_SetItemString(d, "error", ErrorObject);
02046     Py_DECREF(ErrorObject);
02047 
02048     /* needed for get/setMaterialType */
02049     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_TEXFACE_MATERIAL, KX_TEXFACE_MATERIAL);
02050     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_BLENDER_MULTITEX_MATERIAL, KX_BLENDER_MULTITEX_MATERIAL);
02051     KX_MACRO_addTypesToDict(d, KX_BLENDER_GLSL_MATERIAL, KX_BLENDER_GLSL_MATERIAL);
02052 
02053     // XXXX Add constants here
02054 
02055     // Check for errors
02056     if (PyErr_Occurred())
02057     {
02058         Py_FatalError("can't initialize module Rasterizer");
02059     }
02060 
02061     return d;
02062 }

02065 
02066 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
02067 /* GameKeys: symbolic constants for key mapping                              */
02068 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
02069 
02070 static char GameKeys_module_documentation[] =
02071 "This modules provides defines for key-codes"
02072 ;
02073 
02074 static char gPyEventToString_doc[] =
02075 "EventToString(event) - Take a valid event from the GameKeys module or Keyboard Sensor and return a name"
02076 ;
02077 
02078 static PyObject* gPyEventToString(PyObject*, PyObject* value)
02079 {
02080     PyObject* mod, *dict, *key, *val, *ret = NULL;
02081     Py_ssize_t pos = 0;
02082     
02083     mod = PyImport_ImportModule( "GameKeys" );
02084     if (!mod)
02085         return NULL;
02086     
02087     dict = PyModule_GetDict(mod);
02088     
02089     while (PyDict_Next(dict, &pos, &key, &val)) {
02090         if (PyObject_RichCompareBool(value, val, Py_EQ)) {
02091             ret = key;
02092             break;
02093         }
02094     }
02095     
02096     PyErr_Clear(); // in case there was an error clearing
02097     Py_DECREF(mod);
02098     if (!ret)   PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "GameKeys.EventToString(int): expected a valid int keyboard event");
02099     else        Py_INCREF(ret);
02100     
02101     return ret;
02102 }
02103 
02104 static char gPyEventToCharacter_doc[] =
02105 "EventToCharacter(event, is_shift) - Take a valid event from the GameKeys module or Keyboard Sensor and return a character"
02106 ;
02107 
02108 static PyObject* gPyEventToCharacter(PyObject*, PyObject* args)
02109 {
02110     int event, shift;
02111     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"ii:EventToCharacter", &event, &shift))
02112         return NULL;
02113     
02114     if (IsPrintable(event)) {
02115         char ch[2] = {'\0', '\0'};
02116         ch[0] = ToCharacter(event, (bool)shift);
02117         return PyUnicode_FromString(ch);
02118     }
02119     else {
02120         return PyUnicode_FromString("");
02121     }
02122 }
02123 
02124 
02125 static struct PyMethodDef gamekeys_methods[] = {
02126     {"EventToCharacter", (PyCFunction)gPyEventToCharacter, METH_VARARGS, (const char *)gPyEventToCharacter_doc},
02127     {"EventToString", (PyCFunction)gPyEventToString, METH_O, (const char *)gPyEventToString_doc},
02128     { NULL, (PyCFunction) NULL, 0, NULL }
02129 };
02130 
02131 static struct PyModuleDef GameKeys_module_def = {
02132     {}, /* m_base */
02133     "GameKeys",  /* m_name */
02134     GameKeys_module_documentation,  /* m_doc */
02135     0,  /* m_size */
02136     gamekeys_methods,  /* m_methods */
02137     0,  /* m_reload */
02138     0,  /* m_traverse */
02139     0,  /* m_clear */
02140     0,  /* m_free */
02141 };

02306 
02307 // utility function for loading and saving the globalDict
02308 int saveGamePythonConfig( char **marshal_buffer)
02309 {
02310     int marshal_length = 0;
02311     PyObject* gameLogic = PyImport_ImportModule("GameLogic");
02312     if (gameLogic) {
02313         PyObject* pyGlobalDict = PyDict_GetItemString(PyModule_GetDict(gameLogic), "globalDict"); // Same as importing the module
02314         if (pyGlobalDict) {
02315 #ifdef Py_MARSHAL_VERSION   
02316             PyObject* pyGlobalDictMarshal = PyMarshal_WriteObjectToString(  pyGlobalDict, 2); // Py_MARSHAL_VERSION == 2 as of Py2.5
02317 #else
02318             PyObject* pyGlobalDictMarshal = PyMarshal_WriteObjectToString(  pyGlobalDict ); 
02319 #endif
02320             if (pyGlobalDictMarshal) {
02321                 // for testing only
02322                 // PyObject_Print(pyGlobalDictMarshal, stderr, 0);
02323                 char *marshal_cstring;
02324                 
02325                 marshal_cstring = PyBytes_AsString(pyGlobalDictMarshal); // py3 uses byte arrays
02326                 marshal_length= PyBytes_Size(pyGlobalDictMarshal);
02327                 *marshal_buffer = new char[marshal_length + 1];
02328                 memcpy(*marshal_buffer, marshal_cstring, marshal_length);
02329                 Py_DECREF(pyGlobalDictMarshal);
02330             } else {
02331                 printf("Error, bge.logic.globalDict could not be marshal'd\n");
02332             }
02333         } else {
02334             printf("Error, bge.logic.globalDict was removed\n");
02335         }
02336         Py_DECREF(gameLogic);
02337     } else {
02338         PyErr_Clear();
02339         printf("Error, bge.logic failed to import bge.logic.globalDict will be lost\n");
02340     }
02341     return marshal_length;
02342 }
02343 
02344 int loadGamePythonConfig(char *marshal_buffer, int marshal_length)
02345 {
02346     /* Restore the dict */
02347     if (marshal_buffer) {
02348         PyObject* gameLogic = PyImport_ImportModule("GameLogic");
02349 
02350         if (gameLogic) {
02351             PyObject* pyGlobalDict = PyMarshal_ReadObjectFromString(marshal_buffer, marshal_length);
02352             if (pyGlobalDict) {
02353                 PyObject* pyGlobalDict_orig = PyDict_GetItemString(PyModule_GetDict(gameLogic), "globalDict"); // Same as importing the module.
02354                 if (pyGlobalDict_orig) {
02355                     PyDict_Clear(pyGlobalDict_orig);
02356                     PyDict_Update(pyGlobalDict_orig, pyGlobalDict);
02357                 } else {
02358                     /* this should not happen, but cant find the original globalDict, just assign it then */
02359                     PyDict_SetItemString(PyModule_GetDict(gameLogic), "globalDict", pyGlobalDict); // Same as importing the module.
02360                 }
02361                 Py_DECREF(gameLogic);
02362                 Py_DECREF(pyGlobalDict);
02363                 return 1;
02364             } else {
02365                 Py_DECREF(gameLogic);
02366                 PyErr_Clear();
02367                 printf("Error could not marshall string\n");
02368             }
02369         } else {
02370             PyErr_Clear();
02371             printf("Error, bge.logic failed to import bge.logic.globalDict will be lost\n");
02372         }   
02373     }
02374     return 0;
02375 }
02376 
02377 void pathGamePythonConfig(char *path)
02378 {
02379     int len = strlen(gp_GamePythonPathOrig); // Always use the first loaded blend filename
02380     
02381     BLI_strncpy(path, gp_GamePythonPathOrig, sizeof(gp_GamePythonPathOrig));
02382 
02383     /* replace extension */
02384     if (BLI_testextensie(path, ".blend")) {
02385         strcpy(path+(len-6), ".bgeconf");
02386     } else {
02387         strcpy(path+len, ".bgeconf");
02388     }
02389 }
02390 
02391 void setGamePythonPath(const char *path)
02392 {
02393     BLI_strncpy(gp_GamePythonPath, path, sizeof(gp_GamePythonPath));
02394     BLI_cleanup_file(NULL, gp_GamePythonPath); /* not absolutely needed but makes resolving path problems less confusing later */
02395     
02396     if (gp_GamePythonPathOrig[0] == '\0')
02397         BLI_strncpy(gp_GamePythonPathOrig, path, sizeof(gp_GamePythonPathOrig));
02398 }
02399 
02400 // we need this so while blender is open (not blenderplayer)
02401 // loading new blendfiles will reset this on starting the
02402 // engine but loading blend files within the BGE wont overwrite gp_GamePythonPathOrig
02403 void resetGamePythonPath()
02404 {
02405     gp_GamePythonPathOrig[0] = '\0';
02406 }
02407 
02408 #endif // WITH_PYTHON
